data.title: The Best Portland Trail Blazers Point Guards of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 400 sports fans have voted on the 50+ athletes on Best Portland Trail Blazers Point Guards of All Time. Current Top 3: Damian Lillard, Terry Porter, ...
data.text:
Ranked By

2.5K votes

469 voters

1 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Portland Trail Blazers

Latest additions: Malcolm Brogdon

Most divisive: Dan Dickau

Over 400 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Portland Trail Blazers Point Guards of All Time

Big fan of Portland basketball? Then check out this list of Portland Trail Blazers point guards. It includes almost every point guard from throughout Portland Trail Blazers history, including current point guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA point guards of all time, the best Trail Blazers PGs include Rod Strickland, Terry Porter, Damon Stoudamire, and Steve Blake.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Portland Trail Blazers starting PGs and backup PGs are Damian Lillard, Anfernee Simons, and Dennis Smith Jr.

Who are the best point guards in Portland Trail Blazers history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Trail Blazers PG of all time!

Birthplace : Oakland, California

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Portland Trail Blazers

Position : Point guard

Portland Trail Blazers: 2012–2022

Damian Lillard, a fearless leader and clutch performer, has earned his place among the Trail Blazers' all-time greats since being drafted in 2012. Known for his deep range and excellent playmaking skills, Lillard has consistently led the team to success. Throughout his tenure with the Blazers, he has racked up multiple All-Star appearances and All-NBA honors, solidifying his legacy as one of the franchise's elite point guards.

Birthplace : Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Portland Trail Blazers: 1985–1995

A consummate professional, Terry Porter was drafted by the Blazers in 1985 and quickly became an essential part of the team's success. His unselfish play and ability to distribute the ball made him a perfect fit for the high-scoring Blazers teams of the late 80s and early 90s. Porter's greatest achievements include two All-Star selections and an appearance in the 1990 NBA Finals, where he played a key role in the team's memorable playoff run.

Birthplace : Oregon, USA, Portland

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Portland Trail Blazers: 1997–2005

Damon Stoudamire, affectionately known as Mighty Mouse, was acquired by the Trail Blazers in a blockbuster trade in 1998. The dynamic point guard instantly energized the team with his electrifying speed and scoring prowess, earning him a devoted fanbase in Portland. While Stoudamire never won any major awards during his stint with the Blazers, his contributions to the team's success during the early 2000s are fondly remembered by the Rip City faithful.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Portland Trail Blazers: 1992–1996, 2000–2001

An incredible ball-handler and passer, Rod Strickland made his way to the Trail Blazers via trade in 1992. His flashy style of play and ability to create shots for both himself and his teammates made him an instant fan favorite. Though his time in Portland was relatively brief, Strickland's talent and impact on the team are still regarded as some of the finest for a Blazers point guard.

Birthplace : Arkansas City, Kansas

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Portland Trail Blazers: 1975–1980

An outstanding defender and floor leader, Lionel Hollins helped guide the Trail Blazers to their only NBA Championship in 1977. Drafted by the Blazers in 1975, Hollins played a critical role in the team's transformation into a contender. His contributions to the storied championship squad are forever etched in the hearts of Blazers fans.

Birthplace : Darby, Pennsylvania

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Portland Trail Blazers

Position : Guard

Portland Trail Blazers: 1970–1976

Geoff Petrie, the first-ever draft pick in Trail Blazers history in 1970, immediately made his mark as a prolific scorer and floor general. His smooth shooting and leadership skills helped establish the foundation for the young franchise. Petrie's standout achievements include being named the Rookie of the Year in 1971 and earning two All-Star selections.
